The '''Sack of Ashemark''' is an event in the [[War of the Five Kings]] and part of Robb Stark's invasion of [[the Westerlands]] following the liberation of much of [[the Riverlands]] from [[Lannister]] occupation.
sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels it is mentioned that Ashemark is easily sacked by Robb's army, and the keep's castellan is killed. Lacking the necessary strength to capture [[Casterly Rock]] or [[Lannisport]], the Northern army raids the Westerlands: [[Galbart Glover]] and Rickard Karstark raid along the coast, [[Maege Mormont]] captures thousands of livestock, and [[Greatjon Umber]] - who in the novels remains with Robb - captures the gold mines at [[Castamere]], Nunn's Deep, and Pendric Hills.
sections.History:
===Prelude===
The northern army led by [[Robb Stark]] invades [[the Westerlands]], surprising the host led by Ser [[Stafford Lannister]] at [[Oxcross]] and [[Battle of Oxcross|annihilating]] it. With the bulk of the Lannister force stationed at [[Harrenhal]] and the remnants of [[Jaime Lannister]]'s army already scattered, the Westerlands are largely defenseless.
===Battle===
Following the victory at Oxcross, the Northern army sacks [[Ashemark]], seat of [[House Marbrand]].<ref>Season 2 bluray: "War of the Five Kings" feature</ref>

===Aftermath===
Following the sacking of Ashemark, Robb's army pushes deeper into the Westerlands, resulting in a new victory in the [[Battle of the Yellow Fork]] and the subsequent [[Surrender of the Crag|surrender]] of [[House Westerling]].
